message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is about sentiment classification in social media, which is a common topic in natural language processing (NLP) and computational linguistics (CL). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also uses machine learning techniques, such as gated recurrent units (GRUs) and fully connected layers, which are common in the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper involves information retrieval (IR) tasks, such as detecting sentiments toward people, organizations, and events, which could fall under cs.IR (Information Retrieval). Finally, the paper presents a new approach that outperforms state-of-the-art baselines, which could be relevant to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
